top_comment.text:
wie immer interessant!
Bei der Ice bucket challenge hat sich das Wunderland Team viele Gedanken 
zur Umwelt gemacht. Daumen Hoch!! Aber was ist eigentlich mit all den 
Eimern?﻿
top_comment.author: Dominik Blaser

captions.text: At first, an important info:
YouTube has chanced the setting
in the channel subscription.
If you want to rank our current videos
high on the list of suggestions always,
you have to click onto the cog wheel next to the "SUBSCRIBE"-button.
A dialog box will open in which you can set two checkmarks.
The top checkmark means that you'll receive a mail
whenever our new videos get published.
The lower button will show it in your suggestion list.
Simply click on "Save"
and you'll always be up-to-date
regarding our videos on YouTube.
"Bella Italia":
In the summer a large Miniatur Wunderland team
travelled to Italy in order to do
research for our new layout in construction.
Their journey took the 4 groups
to some of the most important Italien landmarks.
We followed three of the teams for one day each.
First stop: Leguria.
After the check-in at the hotel they had to explore
the nearby surroundings first.
The gorgeous village Riomaggiore will be the template
for all little coastline dwellings in Mini-Italy.
Besides houses standing side-by-side,
Riomaggiore offers a little harbor
or rather: A fortified beach.
To build the replica as authentic as possible
original pieces have to be gathered just as much
as perfect pictures of the panorama.
In the early morning, Gaston went on the way
to a stone pier to get the best view.
It was worth his while!
Next stop: Venice, city of channels...
...and pigeons!
First item on the agenda: The Piazza San Marco
with the world-famous birdflocks.
But also the gorgeous buildings
were in the focus of our model makers.
After a short trip with the water taxi across the channels
a Venice woman guided the team
through the narrow streets and alleys.
Of interest were the architecture, Venetian art
and all those small charming details.
This is a shop which we'd like to recreate.
This is a nice elderly man who makes everything himself:
He binds the books, makes the leather covers,
and he restores many old books.
The shop is beautiful, all made with wood
and all kinds of old trinkets within.
We will make a few photos, yet,
and hope to depict it as realistic as possible
at our layout later on.
Last leg of the journey was the capital of Italy: Rome!
Focus of our interest was the main station, of course.
At all niches and corners we took pictures
in order to build the replica at Wunderland
as authentic as possible.
Typical trains belong to it just as much as
as destinctive details of the building.
Maybe you could see that the ceiling here looks quite funny.
Everywhere parts are missing and pieces broke off here and there.
Of course, we took pictures of this, because:
our model makers pay attention to all that sh&%!
Of course, in our train station pieces of the ceiling must be missing,
some parts will not be particularly beautiful, etc.
That's typically Wunderland:
We consider each and every detail.
That entail that we depict the ceiling just as the original
even underneath the ceiling.
Also, the model makers were looking forward
to the historic center of town.
Everything had to be documented meticulously,
in order to build decorations and statues accurately.
Last leg on this exploratoy trip was the St. Peter's Square
in front of the setting of Vatican City.
For one of the most impressive replica on the layout
hundreds of pictures were taken.
Now we have to sort out our impressions, then we'll begin construction.
At the end of August the model makers were even more busy.
The small dioramas are part of the event "Everywhere is Wunderland".
A treasure hunt throughout Hamburg.
If you find one, or even all of the 30 dioramas,
which we have hidden at known and interesting sites in Hamburg,
you can win prizes worth 20,000 Euro altogether.
You can simply sign on at the website shown here.
If you find a diorama at one of the sites
which we roughly marked on the map,
enter the codeword attached near or at the model.
Upload a photo of the site as evidence,
and then you're registered for participation.
Each diorama is linked with a specific prize.
If you actually find all of them, an even bigger loot is awaiting you.
This project ends September 30th 2014.
So, use the remaining time and find Wunderland everywhere in Hamburg.
Past summer was characterized by many challenges
which circulated social networks.
Wunderland was not spared from challenge nominations.
We were somewhat sceptical
whether to accept our nominations or not,
but decided to participate after all.
In June we had to meet with the Cold Water Challenge.
Different fire departments nominated each other,
and within 48 hours the entire brigade
had to come into contact with cold water.
The Knuffingen fire department had some problems
in finding suitable waterholes.
In the very last second only a full bath
in the Scandinavia water basin was possible.
Gerrit, being the head of the Knuffingen fire department
had to fish them out of the ice-cold waters.
Challenge passed!
The second big task this summer was the "Ice Bucket Challenge"
A nominee had to pour a bucket full of water and ice cubes
over his head, or donate to the ALS-Association
to benefit the research and treatment of this illness.
Wunderland decided to meet this project somewhat differently.
For each of the Wunderlanders behind us,
not the entire team, because we've business hours upstairs,
we'll donate 100 Dollar, about 5000 Euro, altogether.
We'll divide the sum: One half to benefit ALS research.
Due to the controversy about animal experimentation we're unsure,
so we decided to donate to the ALS Ambulanz Charité in Berlin.
They take care of research and treatment.
We'll support a local organisation:
"DUNKELZIFFER e.V.", an association for missing kids.
And we want to address international problems.
We thought, currently it's best
to support orphans in Syria.
Also, there're critical voices about the waste of water.
In Hamburg, it's not a problem at all,
but, in large regions of the world, therefore:
"VIVA CON AQUA" attends
to the water supply in Africa.
They'll get part of the money we raise.
Last, but not least, we have to point out,
that ice cube production consumes a lot of power.
You buy it at the 7-11.
If you had donated all of that money,
who knows how much you would have raised.
But, the waste of energy is in Africa,
as well as the environment in general, a big issue.
"ENGINEERS WITHOUT FRONTIERS"
have great projects regarding renewable energies
especially in Africa.
And as we said: Water is scarce,
therefore, we took our water from the Elbe River.
Stinks a little, but the Elbe will forgive us, she has plenty.
This morning we fetched the ice cubes from the fish market.
They're leftovers. They're no longer needed,
after all that fish was stored on the ice.
A bit smelly, let's see how we cope with it.
Because all "Non-Hamburgers" charmingly nickname us "Fish Heads"
we said to ourselves:
"Let's pour that fish soup over our heads, right?!"

title: MiWuLa News TV September 2014: Italienreise, Schnitzeljagd und andere Rückblicke
